item.description: This tour provides an overview of the history of the Amoskeag Manufacturing Company and its vast millyard. The program starts with an orientation in the Millyard Museum. The Amoskeag's textile producing factory complex was the largest in New England. The company existed from 1831 to 1936, and was a success story of the Industrial Revolution in America. The company developed a new city - Manchester - to support its operations. The tour is led by Aurore Eaton, Executive Director. The tour lasts from 10:30 a.m.-12:30 p.m. Pre-registration is required. Please wear comfortable walking shoes. MHA MEMBERS $5.00 - GENERAL PUBLIC $10.00.
item.name: Walking Tour of the Amoskeag Millyard
